Classes¶

Note

Please note that this documentation is still very much under construction. This is just a brief overview of some classes. More details will be added soon.

Work¶

class Work¶

base class for all classes representing a unit of work of a POWtype as provided by the pool protocol (e.g. see WorkEthash) this unit of work does not necessarily correspond to e.g. a stratum job, it may be a work representation of smaller granularity. The pool protocol implementation is incentivized to make this work of appropriate size (read: amount of work, not byte size) so that minimal overhead is required on the AlgoImpl side to make use of it. Data that is specific to Pool protocol implementations may not be added to a Work subclass, but rather to a WorkProtocolData subclass

Subclassed by miner::WorkCuckoo< PowTypeT >, miner::WorkEthash

Public Functions

virtual ~Work()¶
bool expired() const¶

checks whether a solution to this work will still be accepted by the pool protocol. expired() may be used as a hint to the algorithm that calculating solutions to this work package is not beneficial anymore. Upon expiration it is expected (but not necessary) that an algorithm stops working on this work and acquires fresh work from the pool.

Return

whether the work has been marked expired by the pool protocol implementation

template<class WorkSolutionT>
unique_ptr<WorkSolutionT> makeWorkSolution() const¶

creates a solution object for this work object. creates a solution object which can be filled with the algorithm results to then be submitted to the Pool. There can be many WorkSolution objects generated from a single Work instance. A solution object does not necessarily need to be submitted. WorkSolution objects must be created through this function in order to be properly tied to a Work object (via the private protocolData member) That way the pool protocol implementation can track which solution belongs to which work package. A pool can make work objects expire (which can be queried via Work::expired()). This may be used as a hint to abort any calculations and acquire a new work object, however it is not required to do so. There is no obligation to check for expiration before submitting a solution

Return

a WorkSolutionT wrapped in a unique_ptr in order to allow passing it later in a type erased fashion (as unique_ptr<WorkSolution>) without slicing

Template Parameters

  • WorkSolutionT: Type of the Solution object that corresponds to this work’s dynamic type (e.g. WorkSolutionEthash for WorkEthash).

Public Members

const std::string powType¶

Private Members

std::weak_ptr<WorkProtocolData> protocolData¶

type erased protocol data which also works for finding out whether work has expired via weak_ptr’s expired() functionality

WorkSolution¶

class WorkSolution¶

Solution counterpart of the Work class. Every Work subclass is expected to have a corresponding WorkSolution subclass for a given POWtype. WorkSolutions should be created via a Work’s makeWorkSolution<T>() method, filled with the actual proof of work data and then submitted to the Pool.

Subclassed by miner::WorkSolutionCuckoo< PowTypeT >, miner::WorkSolutionEthash

Public Functions

std::weak_ptr<WorkProtocolData> getProtocolData() const¶

access type erased protocol data (use tryGetProtocolDataAs<T>() instead if you want to upcast it anyways)

Return

type erased pool protocol specific data (such as stratum job id for stratum)

template<class T>
std::shared_ptr<T> tryGetProtocolDataAs() const¶

convenience function for getting the upcasted protocol data in the pool protocol implementation code

Return

protocol data as T or nullptr iff work has expired

Template Parameters

  • T: type that the protocolData is supposed to be upcasted to

virtual ~WorkSolution()¶

Public Members

const std::string powType¶

Private Members

std::weak_ptr<WorkProtocolData> protocolData¶

Pool¶

class Pool : public miner::StillAliveTrackable¶

common base class for all Pool protocol implementations contains facilities for registering Pool Impls in a global list, so that the appropriate PoolImpl class can be selected and instantiated based on a name string when subclassing Pool, do not forget to add your PoolImpl class to the registry in ‘Algorithm.cpp’

Subclassed by miner::PoolDummy, miner::PoolEthashStratum, miner::PoolGrinStratum, miner::PoolSwitcher

Public Functions

virtual cstring_span getName() const = 0¶
virtual uint64_t getPoolUid() const = 0¶

Return

uid that makes it possible to identify which WorkSolution belongs to which pool in a PoolSwitcher

virtual optional<unique_ptr<Work>> tryGetWork() = 0¶

tryGetWork call as implemented by the Pool subclasses (aka PoolImpls) this method is only supposed to be called by the templated tryGetWork<WorkT>() method below. this method tries to return valid work as quickly as possible, but also blocks for a short amount of time to wait for work to become available if it isn’t already when the call is being made. After a short timeout period with still no work available, nullopt is returned.

Return

type erased valid unique_ptr or nullopt

virtual void submitWorkImpl(unique_ptr<WorkSolution> solution) = 0¶

submitWorkImpl call as implemented by the Pool subclasses (aka PoolImpls) this method is only supposed to be called by the templated submitWork<WorkSolutionT>() method below. this method takes the ownership of the given solution and starts its async submission, so that this method can return quickly without blocking.

Parameters

  • solution: the solution to be submitted to the pool

template<class WorkT>
optional<unique_ptr<WorkT>> tryGetWork()¶

obtain work from a pool this method is supposed to be called from within an AlgoImpl. It is the intended way of obtaining work from a pool this method tries to return valid work as quickly as possible, but also blocks for a short amount of time to wait for work to become available if it isn’t already when the call is being made. After a short timeout period with still no work available, nullopt is returned. This method is supposed to be called repeatedly in a loop in AlgoImpls, and will not cause busy waiting if nullopt is returned repeatedly due to its internal timeout mechanism

Return

a valid unique_ptr containing work or a nullopt optional

Template Parameters

  • WorkT: the Work subclass for a specific POWtype

template<class WorkSolutionT>
void submitWork(unique_ptr<WorkSolutionT> result)¶

submit a found solution to the pool this method is supposed to be called from within an AlgoImpl. It is the intended way of submitting solutions. this method takes the ownership of the given solution and starts its async submission, so that this method can return quickly without blocking. AlgoImpls usually check the validity of a Solution before submitting through this call

Parameters

  • solution: the solution to be submitted to the pool

std::string getPoolImplName() const¶

Return

string name of the Pool subclass (aka PoolImpl) as it can be passed to makePool

std::string getPowType() const¶

get the POWtype that this Pool implements (e.g. in order to connect it with a fitting AlgoImpl, or group it with Pools that support the same POWtype in a PoolSwitcher)

Return

this pool’s supported POWtype as a string

struct Entry¶

Entry in the global registry of Pool subclasses (aka PoolImpls) it associates a makeFunc (a function that can instantiate a certain subclass) with runtime string arguments as they would come from the config

Public Members

const std::string poolImplName¶
const std::string powType¶
const std::string protocolType¶
const std::string protocolTypeAlias¶
std::function<unique_ptr<Pool>PoolConstructionArgs)> miner::Pool::Entry::makeFunc
template<typename T>
struct Registry¶

Public Functions

Registry(const std::string &poolImplName, const std::string &powType, std::string protocolType, std::string protocolTypeAlias = "")¶

Registers a new PoolImpl globally, so it can be identified and instantiated based on user provided config arguments

Parameters

  • poolImplName: string that uniquely identifies the Pool subclass (= PoolImpl)

  • powType: powType (e.g. “ethash”) that this PoolImpl generates Work/accepts solutions for

  • protocolType: name of the protocol as it will be called by the user in the config file

  • protocolTypeAlias: optionally an alternative name for the protocol that gets mapped to the actual name above

Registry()¶
DELETE_COPY_AND_MOVE(Registry)¶

Algorithm¶

class Algorithm¶

common base class for all AlgoImpls contains facilities for registering AlgoImpls in a global list, so that the appropriate AlgoImpl class can be selected and instantiated based on a name string when subclassing Algorithm, do not forget to add your algorithm to the registry in ‘Algorithm.cpp’

Subclassed by miner::AlgoCuckatoo31Cl, miner::AlgoDummy, miner::AlgoEthashCL

Public Functions

virtual ~Algorithm()¶
DELETE_COPY_AND_MOVE(Algorithm)¶

Public Static Functions

unique_ptr<Algorithm> makeAlgo(AlgoConstructionArgs args, const std::string &algoImplName)¶

instantiates (runs) the AlgoImpl type that matches a name string AlgoImpl classes are written in such a way that they start mining as soon as they are instantiated and stop as they are destroyed, thus this call starts the mining process (provided the algorithm can obtain work from the Pool referenced by args)

Return

type erased AlgoImpl or nullptr if algoImplName matches no registered AlgoImpl class

Parameters

  • args: AlgoConstructionArgs that are forwarded into the selected AlgoImpl class’ ctor

  • algoImplName: string name that specifies the AlgoImpl class

std::string powTypeForAlgoImplName(const std::string &algoImplName)¶

LockGuarded¶

template<class T, class Mutex>
class LockGuarded¶

Wrapper around an instance of T that is only accessible after acquiring a lock. LockGuarded contains a T instance t that is associated with a mutex. t is only accessible via the lock() method which returns an object of type Locked<…>. This Locked<…> object acts as a RAII-style lock guard, but also provides operator-> and operator* for accessing the T instance.

Template Parameters

  • T: type of the instance which is to be protected by the mutex

Public Types

template<>
using value_type = T¶
template<>
using mutex_type = Mutex¶

Public Functions

DELETE_COPY_AND_MOVE(LockGuarded)¶

LockGuarded(Args&&... args)¶
auto lock() const¶

Return

Locked<…> that allows access to only the const interface of the wrapped T via operator* and ->

Return
